What's On

Our carefully curated programme is designed to bring you exciting new theatre, laugh-out-loud comedy and a diverse range of live music acts.

Filters

Playtime at Printers Playhouse

theatre
10:15 Saturday 26 Jun 2021

An adventure through space... a new planet every week...

Join our interactive, immersive storytelling experience! Let our professional storytelling performers whisk you away to awesome new planets every week... ...becoming intergalactic explorers flying through the stars... ...meet weird and wonderful inhabitants while traversing strange and astonishing new landscapes... ...watch the space opera unfold then become part of the story through imaginative improvisation and role play! 3-6 Yrs 10.15 – 11am 7-11 Yrs 11.30 – 12.30pm Mixed age families can attend together Tickets £8 each Discount for block bookings Book by emailing us at: Info@printersplayhouse.co.uk On Saturdays ending July 31st

Book by emailing us at: info@printersplayhouse.co.uk

The Great Fire

music
20:00 Saturday 26 Jun 2021

With support from Deano and the Danglers

The Great Fire bring their eclectic, electric playlist to Printers Playhouse. The 4-piece band from Eastbourne will be playing feel-good covers from more than 5 decades of Pop, Rock, Funk and Blues. Visit www.thegreatfire.co.uk to find out more

Book by emailing us at: info@printersplayhouse.co.uk

Quiz

Event
20:30 Sunday 27 Jun 2021

Our wildly successful Quiz in the Dark as moved to a permanent spot inside on a Sunday night...

Our wildly successful Quiz in the Dark as moved to a permanent spot inside on a Sunday night... ...Join us for a quiz like no other, now hosted inside our beautiful venue by our very own bar manager Ross the 'Ginja Ninja' Smith. Drinks, laughs and prizes to be won. Ticket MUST be booked in advance. £2 per person to play, max 6 per team. Please email ross@printersplayhouse.co.uk to ‘book your bubble’.

Book by emailing us at: info@printersplayhouse.co.uk

Happenings

theatre
19:30 Friday 2 Jul 2021

Printers at the Grove A new play by John Berry

In these tough times, Life’s a struggle. There’s unfulfilled expectations. Humdrum existences needing an injection of life. Millions wishing something, would happen to them, to fill the void in their lives. Clearly everyone “else” is happy. Online celebrations and holiday pics prove it. Jane can’t take it anymore. She needs that something, anything! but how far is she willing to go to get it? If you purchased a ticket or tickets for the original run of Happenings at the Grove in December 2020, but were unable to attend on account of being resident in a then-Tier 3 or 4 area, you may exchange your ticket(s) for either of these two performances. Please contact us at grovetheatreeastbourne@gmail.com for your exchange to be processed. This does not apply to those who received refunds on their tickets.

Book by emailing us at: info@printersplayhouse.co.uk

The Pilgrim Mother

music
20:30 Friday 2 Jul 2021

The Pilgrim Mothers are a five-piece musical collective from the South Coast of England, where the waves crash and the seabirds fly.

The Pilgrim Mothers are a five-piece musical collective from the South Coast of England, where the waves crash and the seabirds fly. We make vintage, rootsy, folky, soulful sounds and play brand new original songs about life, love and longing - as well as eclectic covers including songs by Tom Waits, Van Morrison, vintage gospel, blues and wartime tunes. Celebrating the past, singing for a better now. Tickets £5 per person All events are pre booked in bubbles please email info@printersplayhouse.co.uk to get your bubbles booked.

Book by emailing us at: info@printersplayhouse.co.uk

Book Club

community
10:30 Wednesday 7 Jul 2021

Join a relaxed group of like minded locals interested in having a natter about a good book!

Join a relaxed group of like minded locals interested in having a natter about a good book! Come along to the first session to discuss what books we enjoy and what we would to read. Books will be chosen by consensus. We are currently reading 'The Carer' By Deborah Moggach. PPH Book Club is a monthly free group meeting Wednesdays 10.30 - 11.30

Book by emailing us at: info@printersplayhouse.co.uk

Open Stage

music
20:00 Wednesday 7 Jul 2021

Musicians, poets, storytellers, comedians are all welcome! Basically anyone who needs a mic to express their art.

The best open mic in Eastbourne. Free entry and first act from 8pm. All musicians welcome! All poets welcome! All storytellers welcome! All comedians welcome! Ticket MUST be booked in advance. £10 holding deposits for tables. All events are in pre-booked ‘bubbles’ Book your bubbles by emailing us at: info@printersplayhouse.co.uk

Book by emailing us at: info@printersplayhouse.co.uk

music
20:30 Wednesday 7 Jul 2021

Our new regular Thursday Karaoke night we is continuing on with an acoustic theme...

Our new regular Thursday Karaoke night we is continuing on with an acoustic theme... Go to www.olioke.uk to see what songs we have available... email info@printersplayhouse.co.uk to book your table. Bring a mic... or a hairbrush... to sing into as (due to COVID) we can't share mics!

Book by emailing us at: info@printersplayhouse.co.uk

Beginners Chair Yoga

workshops
10:30 Thursday 8 Jul 2021

Ashley from Lotus Lessons will support you through a gentle chair based practice that is focused on mindful movement and meditation.

Ashley from Lotus Lessons will support you through a gentle chair based practice that is focused on mindful movement and meditation. Sessions are accessible for all with modifications given where needed. Beginners Yoga - Weekly £10 Thur May 20th 10.30am-11.30am

Book by emailing us at: info@printersplayhouse.co.uk

Collage Club

workshops
14:00 Thursday 8 Jul 2021

All abilities welcome to experiment with collage and make art in a supportive environment.

All abilities welcome to experiment with collage and make art in a supportive environment. Join Sarah in using found and made collage materials to explore creative expression.

Red Green and Blue

music
20:30 Friday 9 Jul 2021

Red, Green and Blue: an acoustic duo whose dynamic performances feature beautiful vocal harmonies.....

Red, Green and Blue: an acoustic duo whose dynamic performances feature beautiful vocal harmonies..... Brian McDonald and Megan Ramsey are Kent based acoustic duo "Red Green and Blue", their dynamic performances feature beautiful vocal harmonies original music and lyrics. "The magic that seems to happen when Brian's voice and mine combine is one of the great joys of performing with him." Tickets £5 per person..... Please email info@printersplayhouse.co.uk to book your bubbles......

Book by emailing us at: info@printersplayhouse.co.uk

Eastbourne Filmmakers Evening

Film
20:30 Saturday 10 Jul 2021

Come join Eastbourne’s filmmaking circle as we celebrate local and neighbouring shorts - from zero budgets upwards. Everyone is welcome to share or just come along to watch and chat to the creators afterwards.

Come join Eastbourne’s filmmaking circle as we celebrate local and neighbouring shorts - from zero budgets upwards. Everyone is welcome to share or just come along to watch and chat to the creators afterwards. A chance for filmmakers in the Eastbourne, Brighton and Hastings area to come together and share their shorts, trailers, and have a drink and a chat. And if you're not a filmmaker, come along and support your local filmmakers - watch their stuff and give 'em some feedback!

Book by emailing us at: info@printersplayhouse.co.uk

'Eastbourne Pride after Party' with Rick Bonner

music
19:30 Saturday 17 Jul 2021

PPH is the place to be after the towns celebration of inclusivity and diversity. Come and grab a Rainbow drink and party the night away with the fabulous Rick Bonner.

PPH is the place to be after the towns celebration of inclusivity and diversity. Come and grab a Rainbow drink and party the night away with the fabulous Rick Bonner. Rick has a new album out, and we are proud to feature original songs from this hugely popular local musician! Ticket MUST be booked in advance. Limited tickets £5 per person in social distance compliant ‘table bubbles’. Please email info@printersplayhouse.co.uk to ‘book your bubble’. RICK performs some of the greatest songs ever written and recorded by the greatest performers that ever lived. RICK is also an outstanding Jazz SAXOPHONE, and CLARINET PLAYER. Tickets are just £5 per person and must be pre bought for our socially distanced table ‘bubbles’. Book by emailing info@printersplayhouse.co.uk

Book by emailing us at: info@printersplayhouse.co.uk

The Golgis

music
20:30 Saturday 31 Jul 2021

Defying all attempts at categorisation, this fine doodah band lifts the spirits and gladdens hearts!

Defying all attempts at categorisation, this fine doodah band lifts the spirits and gladdens hearts! “The South East's Premier Absurdist Pantomime Acoustic Theatre Art Alternative Folk Rock Band. Attempting to build on the huge success of their hit single 'It's Still a Hoover' (number 173 in the Billingshurst chart), The Golgis have now discovered even more instruments they are unable to play properly" Tickets are just £5 per person and must be pre bought for our socially distanced table ‘bubbles’. Book by emailing info@printersplayhouse.co.uk

Book by emailing us at: info@printersplayhouse.co.uk

Rise & Rhyme

spoken-word
20:00 Saturday 14 Aug 2021

We will be joined by our headliner Shell Huggett performing with Jakob. We also have MC G-Funk, spoken word poets -M.Jumbo, Pixie, J.Berry, Rambling Rose, G.Jones and story-teller Hazel plus many more more..!!!

So pleased to finally be able to host this fantastic spoken word event! We fully sold out the original event, so hope to see everyone who already has a ticket... let us know if you can make it... We will be joined by our headliner Shell Huggett performing with Jakob. We also have MC G-Funk, spoken word poets -M.Jumbo, Pixie, J.Berry, Rambling Rose, G.Jones and story-teller Hazel plus many more more..!!!

Book by emailing us at: info@printersplayhouse.co.uk
